CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 2, 1961, pg. 32 reads: "American Woodmen Giants - Winning 6 and losing only 2 games during the 1961 season, this group of youngsters enjoyed a march of triumph that began in May. Left to right, seated: William Grimes, Norman Hunt, Ronald King, Michael Ogden, Melvin Harris, Julius Graham and James Wortham.  Second row, standing: Theodore Fletcher, Jerome Parks, Stanley Page, Carmel Stewart, co-captain; Lawrence Newring, captain; Donald Marbury and Steven Boyd.  Adults in back row are Mrs. Mary Martin, chairman or the advisory board and assistant manager; Mrs. Mildred Allen, supervisor; Lee A. Matthews, coach; Robert Lee Mahaffey, sponsor and manager, and Mrs. Beatrice Mahaffey. Absent were John Brice, Wesley Hawkins and Eddie Turner. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of the American Woodmen Giants Little League baseball players and coaches, from left, seated: William Grimes, Norman Hunt, Ronald King, Michael Ogden, Melvin Harris, Julius Graham, and James Wortham; second row, Theodore Fletcher, Jerome Parks, Stanley Page, Carmel Stewart, Lawrence Newring, Donald Marbury, and Steven Boyd; back row: Mary Martin, Mildred Allen, Lee A. Matthews, Robert Lee Mahaffey, and Mrs. Beatrice Mahaffey, posed on bench on baseball field, possibly Kennard Field
